intro: Salpichroa alata, commonly known as the winged plantain, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, winged bracts that enclose its showy inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Salpichroa alata produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months.
